subject: Re: The Ghost Box, is training required?
author: Jon Maronge
full_text:
obviously steve, you fail to remember when just a week ago i had to
apologize to you for asking you a question that i had no idea you and
the other person did not speak? i was only interested in the
technology and furthering itc research. but i guess that one question
came across too smug.

you said to black bear that he doesn't know you he dislikes you. I
don't think that is the case at all. i still don't have a problem with
you either. all i ever wanted to do is talk about the research you
were doing.

I now have 2 frank's boxes (the GHOSTMAN 3 and FB#33) to do my
research. (btw.. i thanks you a bunch already frank.. so thank you again)

Steve, you come across as an expert is all i am saying. that is why i
contacted you. "boxmaster estraordinaire" is it? For you to say "who
is this guy?" and cause problems for a mutual friend is absurd. so..
for you and everyone to know a little about me...

oct 22 i turn 33 years old. I have been interested in the box
technology for a few years now. i have been doing paranormal
investigations for 19 years now and took a 3 year break (which is when
you popped up on the scene.) Now i'm back and hitting it hard again
and want to be able to use the best equipment that money can't buy.

Frank doesn't even pretend to be an expert nor does he expect his name
to be mentioned every time an article is published. anyways.. i
probably said more than i should have already.

bear... i'm up for that duel.. sounds fun...lol best one wins a
"certificate of expertification" sign by the us president...lol

btw.. one rule bear... no cutting and pasting clips together to make
one up. haha

--jon

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@...> wrote:
>
> 
> I never claimed to be the first on the RS hack, i just posted the 
> first files from it.  I have no ego and have many friends on here 
> that could attest to that, i educate what i have learned along the 
> way and that's all.  No recording duels here, nobody cares anyway.  
> What would that serve?  I only have helped people on here and other 
> boards.  
> 
> -Steve
> 
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, black bear hollow 
> <blackbearhollow@> wrote:
> >
> > Actually I don't know you and therefore can't
> > say if I like you or not. I will say that I've heard
> > who first came up with the RS Hack and your
> > name wasn't it.
> > 
> > I have posted many of my recordings to this
> > list, but don't store them here. I've also heard
> > your files. So? Nothing I haven't heard before,
> > but as always I enjoy listening to everyone's efforts.
> > 
> > What I don't like is an attitude and egomania
> > when it comes to this research.
> > 
> > Next I guess you'll challenge me to a recording
> > duel? LOL. Give that ego a rest.
> > 
> > On Oct 9, 2008, at 7:31 PM, "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@> wrote:
> > 
> > >
> > > You're right and i'm not here to argue with anyone. You obviously
> > > don't know me, but dislike me. That's ok, i like to get along with
> > > people; it helps the research move forward. I would love to hear 
> some
> > > of your files from your frank's boxes and compare notes on what 
> we've
> > > been getting. My results are in the files section here.
> > >
> > > -Steve
> > >
> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, black bear hollow  
> > > <blackbearhollow@>
> > > wrote:
> > > >
> > > > So have I. So has Misty. So has Frank. Mike too. I could go on 
> & on.
> > > > There are many here and on other lists who have contributed 
> years of
> > > > free time way before you showed up on the recording scene.
> > > > Does it matter? No.
